info.title: Tayari Engine API
info.description: This is the official documentation for the Tayari Engine API.It provides all endpoints available for Learners, Instructors, Employers , Program Coordinators and Others.Use this documentation as a guide to integrate or test the Tayari system.

get.description: Fetch admin logs with filters for search, action, and role. Returns paginated logs along with stats (total logs, active users, last 24h logs, and filtered count).

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search by user's first name, last name, or email

post.description: Send a message to one or more recipients via email. Accepts comma-separated list of emails, subject, and message body. Returns a list of successfully sent emails.

message.example: Dear users, the system will be undergoing maintenance tonight at 11:00 PM UTC.
Error sending emails: SMTP connection failed

get.summary: Fetch all aptitude questions for learners
get.description: Requires authentication. Only users with the role 'learner' can access this endpoint. Returns a list of aptitude questions with their options.

data.title: What interests you most?
data.sub_title: Select all areas you'd like to learn about

data.title: What's your current skill level?
data.sub_title: Be honest - this helps us recommend the right courses

403.description: Forbidden - Only learners can access this resource

post.description: Stores learner aptitude test answers, evaluates skill level, career goals, and recommends courses. Requires authentication (role: learner).
Revokes the currently authenticated user's access token and logs them out.

get.summary: Get all badges with user status
get.description: Returns a list of all available badges and whether the authenticated user owns each badge.

200.description: List of badges with user status

message.example: List of badges with user status

get.description: Retrieve a list of all available categories including their details.

description.example: Covers SEO, Ads, and more.

post.description: Create a new category by providing a unique name and an optional description.

description.example: Covers AI, ML, and Deep Learning
Covers AI, ML, and Deep Learning

get.description: Retrieve details of a single category by its ID.

put.description: Update an existing category by ID. Name must be unique (except for the same ID).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the category to update

description.example: Covers Python, R, and Data Engineering
Covers Python, R, and Data Engineering

delete.description: Delete an existing category by ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the category to delete

get.description:
Opens a certificate page in HTML view for a given certificate code. 
     *                  Unlike other API endpoints, this does not return JSON but renders a Blade template (`certificate.blade.php`).

Generates a PDF version of the certificate and triggers download. 
     *                  Unlike JSON API responses, this endpoint returns a binary PDF file.

Returns a list of certificates belonging to the authenticated learner. 
     *                  Requires authentication (Bearer token).
Retrieve a certificate by its ID, including user and course details.

description.example: This is the organic chemistry topic course

get.description: Public endpoint. Returns a list of courses with instructor details, skills, lesson counts, total duration, and enrollment status.

description.example: Learn the basics of programming with hands-on examples.

data.name: Intro to Programming
data.description: Learn the basics of programming with hands-on examples.

data.name: Advanced UI/UX
data.description: Master advanced design systems and UX best practices.

get.description: Returns aggregated counts of courses by status (draft, published, archived) along with total count. Useful for admin course management overview.

get.summary: Get list of courses for admin with filters
get.description: Returns list of courses with title, subtitle, description, instructor info, status, module count, students enrolled, and last updated. Supports search and status filter.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter by course status (draft or published)

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search by course title or instructor name

description.example: This is the organic chemistry topic course

post.description: Creates a new course with thumbnail, modules, lessons (with video uploads), and quizzes including questions. Only accessible by admins.

description.example: Learn the basics of web development including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Learn about HTML structure.
Introduction to common HTML tags.

delete.description: Remove a course by its ID. This will delete the course, module, quiz and all the lessons of that course.  Once deleted, the course  cannot be recovered.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the course to delete

patch.description: Updates an existing course including its thumbnail, modules, lessons, quizzes, and questions. Supports partial updates.

description.example: Updated course description.
Introduction to the basics
Lesson intro

data.description: Updated course with modules, lessons, quizzes, and questions

get.description: Public endpoint. Returns detailed information about a specific course, including its modules, lessons, and quizzes.

description.example: This is the organic chemistry topic course
Overview

data.name: Organic Chemistry
data.description: This is the organic chemistry topic course

patch.description: Sets the course status to published

get.summary: Get admin dashboard stats and system status
get.description: Provides an overview of users, courses, jobs, and system dependencies (database, mail, queue, uptime, error rate). Useful for monitoring application health and high-level admin insights.
Returns dashboard statistics for the authenticated employer, including active job posts, applications, team members, training status, and certificates.

in_training.description: Number of team members currently in training

certificates.description: Number of certificates earned by company members

get.description: Returns statistics about team invitations for the employerâs company (total, pending, active).
Returns an overview of learner statistics such as active courses, certificates, badges, and job matches. Requires authentication.

post.summary: Enroll the authenticated user into a course
post.description: Enrolls the logged-in learner into the specified course. Requires authentication.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the course to enroll in

message.example: You are already enrolled in this course

get.summary: Get progress of the authenticated user in a course
get.description: Returns lessons and quizzes completed vs. total, along with overall progress percentage. Requires authentication.
Retrieve a list of all instructor applications submitted by users.
Retrieve details of a specific instructor application by its ID.

patch.summary: Approve or reject an instructor application (Admin only)
patch.description: Allows an admin to approve or reject an instructor application. If approved, a new instructor user account is created automatically.

items.example: Status can be approved or rejected

post.description: Allows a user to submit an application to become an instructor. The application will remain pending until reviewed by an admin.

post.summary: Assign an instructor to a course
post.description: Assigns an instructor to a specific course by updating the course's instructor_id.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all job posts with their type and required skills.

description.example: We are looking for a skilled frontend developer with React experience.

post.description: Allows an authenticated employer to create a job post with details like title, description, location, job type, required skills, and optional salary range.

description.example: We are looking for a skilled frontend developer with React experience.
We are looking for a skilled frontend developer with React experience.

post.description: Marks the specified lesson as completed for the authenticated learner and recalculates course progress.
Authenticates users and returns a JWT token. All users can log in using this API.

get.description: Starts the Google OAuth flow by redirecting the user to Google's login/consent screen.

302.description: Redirect response to Google login page

get.description:
Handles the Google OAuth callback after a successful login/consent. 
     *         Creates or updates a user, generates an access token, and returns user details.

post.summary: Check if the submitted answer is correct
post.description: Validates the provided answer against the correct option for a given quiz.
Records a learnerâs attempt for a specific quiz. Learner must be enrolled in the course containing the quiz.

message.example: You are not enrolled in this course

post.description: Registers a new user with role-based validations. Can register as learner, instructor, employer, or admin. Employer can self-register with company details, or be added by an authenticated employer. Only super_admin can create admins.

message.description: Only super admin can create admin

get.description: Retrieves a list of all available skills in the system. Authentication is not required.

post.description: Adds a new skill to the system. Authentication is not required.

category_id.description: ID of the category if applicable

get.description: Retrieve details of a specific skill by its ID.

put.description: Update the details of an existing skill by its ID. The skill name must be unique, but the current skill can keep its existing name.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the skill to update

delete.description: Remove a skill by its ID. Once deleted, the skill cannot be recovered.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the skill to delete

get.description: Retrieve the list of available levels such as Beginner, Intermediate, and Difficult.

description.example: Just getting started.

get.summary: Get all teams of the authenticated employer's company
get.description: Returns a list of all teams under the employer's company.

post.description: Employers can create a new team under their company.

get.summary: Get a specific team with invitations
get.description: Returns details of a team along with its invitations.

get.summary: Get all team invitations for the employer
get.description: Returns a list of all invitations sent by the authenticated employerâs company, including team details.

post.summary: Send invitations to join a team
post.description: Allows an employer to invite multiple members to a specific team (or no group if team_id is not provided). Accepts a comma-separated list of email addresses.

team_id.description: Optional Team ID. If not provided, users are invited without a team

post.description:
Allows an invited user to accept a team invitation using the unique token sent via email. 
     *     If the user exists, they are added to the team. If the user does not exist, they are redirected to the registration page with prefilled invitation data.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Invitation token provided in the email

200.description: Invitation accepted and user added to the team

message.example: You have been added to the team successfully.

data.description: Details of the user who accepted the invitation

delete.description: Deletes a specific team invitation by ID. Only available to authenticated employers.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the invitation to delete

get.description: Retrieve a list of users with optional filters. Super admin is excluded from results.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: Filter users by role (e.g., learner, employer, admin, instructor)

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter users by status (e.g., active, inactive, suspended)

delete.description: Soft deletes a user, anonymizes sensitive data, and archives original info. Super admin cannot be deleted.

patch.description: Update user role or status. Super admin cannot be modified.

message.example: You cannot modify a super_admin user.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: APIs related to user authentication like login, logout, registration, password updates, etc.

tags.name: Aptitude
tags.description: APIs related to the learner aptitude tests. They are used right after the learner finishes registration during oboarding.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: User related API's, specifically designed for the admin to manage its users.

tags.name: Dashboard
tags.description: Dashboard API's for all the users. Showing stats and some important data.

tags.name: Courses
tags.description: Courses API for everybody to use it. Courses List, Adding New Courses and Updating the existing ones.

tags.name: Certificates
tags.description: These API endpoints are responsible for getting the learner awarded certificates, downloading,sharing and displaying them for the learner.

tags.name: Quizzes
tags.description: The API endpoint related to Quizzes that a learner takes.

tags.name: Instructor
tags.description: The API endpoint related to Instructor, from applications to getting approved/rejectd.

tags.name: Employer
tags.description: Employers related APIs. From the registration, Team Management and Course Assignments.

tags.name: Admin
tags.description: Endpoints for managing administrative actions such as approving/rejecting instructor applications, overseeing users, and handling system-level operations.

tags.name: Miscellaneous
tags.description: Endpoints that don't fit into a specific module or category. This tag groups together utility, helper, and general-purpose APIs.
